title: Lochee United F.C.
text:
Lochee United Football Club are a Scottish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in the <a href="Lochee">Lochee</a> area of <a href="Dundee">Dundee</a>. Formed in 1892, they currently compete in the <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20East%20Region%20Super%20League">SJFA East Super League North</a> and play their home games at Thomson Park.
History.
After spending their early years as a juvenile and amateur side, United joined the <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20Association">Junior</a> grade in 1959. Their Thomson Park ground was opened by former <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a> and <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a> captain <a href="George%20Young%20%28Scottish%20footballer%29">George Young</a> in the same year.
Achieving notable local success in the late 1970s and 1980s, the club flourished again after the formation of the <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20East%20Region%20Super%20League">East Region Superleague</a> in 2002. Under the management of <a href="Eddie%20Wolecki%20Black">Eddie Wolecki Black</a>, United were promoted as Tayside Premier champions in 2003 and two seasons later, won their first Superleague title. In the same year, they also reached the final of the <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Cup">Scottish Junior Cup</a> for the first, and so far, only time, losing 2–0 to local rivals <a href="Tayport%20F.C.">Tayport</a> at <a href="Tannadice%20Park">Tannadice Park</a>.
Wolecki departed for <a href="Montrose%20F.C.">Montrose</a> in December 2005 but his successor as manager, former <a href="Dundee%20United%20F.C.">Dundee United</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> <a href="Ray%20McKinnon%20%28footballer%29">Ray McKinnon</a>, maintained the clubs' run of success, culminating in a second East Superleague title in 2007–08. This led to their participation in the <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> for the first time. United reached the third round of the competition after beating fellow Junior qualifier <a href="Bathgate%20Thistle%20F.C.">Bathgate Thistle</a> 3–1 in the first round and Highland League side <a href="Buckie%20Thistle%20F.C.">Buckie Thistle</a> 3–0 in the second round. In the third round, Lochee held <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20Second%20Division">Second Division</a> <a href="Ayr%20United%20F.C.">Ayr United</a> to a 1–1 draw at home before going down 3–1 in the replay at <a href="Somerset%20Park">Somerset Park</a>.
They are one of two Junior clubs from Lochee, the other being <a href="Lochee%20Harp%20F.C.">Lochee Harp</a>.
The team has been managed since July 2016 by George Shields.
Lochee won their third East Superleague title in <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20East%20Super%20League">2018–19</a>, making them eligible to enter the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Scottish%20Cup">2019–20 Scottish Cup</a> at the Preliminary round stage.
Honours.
<a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Cup">Scottish Junior Cup</a>
<a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20East%20Region%20Super%20League">SJFA East Region Super League</a>
